title: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do       Craters of the Moon is a volcanic wonderland that is fun to explore. Start at the Visitor Center for informative exhibits, films and advice from staff. Below are some suggested itineraries based on the amount of time that you may have for a visit: Winter Activities For Spring, Summer, & Fall activities, the following times are suggested: 30 minutes  Take in the view along the scenic 7 mile loop drive.  One Hour  Hike the North Crater Flow trail, Spatter Cones and Devil's Orchard Trails.  Two Hours  Hike to Big Craters from the Spatter Cones parking lot. Explore Indian Tunnel (Requires a free cave permit).   1/2 Day  Hike the Broken Top Loop or Tree Molds Trails and explore Buffalo Cave on Broken Top Loop. (Requires a free cave permit).   One Day or Longer  Explore the Craters of the Moon Wilderness (Lava Trees and Echo Crater).
